dt: {bc}any of an order (Scorpionida) of nocturnal arachnids that have an elongated body and a narrow segmented tail bearing a venomous stinger at the tip
{bc}something that incites to action like the sting of an insect

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}eskorpiun{/it}, from Latin {it}scorpion-, scorpio{/it}, from Greek {it}skorpios{/it}
shortdef: any of an order (Scorpionida) of nocturnal arachnids that have an elongated body and a narrow segmented tail bearing a venomous stinger at the tip
a scourge probably studded with metal

dt: {bc}any of numerous aquatic bugs (family Nepidae) with the end of the abdomen prolonged by a long breathing tube

shortdef: any of numerous aquatic bugs (family Nepidae) with the end of the abdomen prolonged by a long breathing tube

dt: {bc}any of an order (Uropygi) of chiefly tropical arachnids somewhat resembling true scorpions but having a long slender caudal process and no sting

shortdef: any of an order (Uropygi) of chiefly tropical arachnids somewhat resembling true scorpions but having a long slender caudal process and no sting
